How can the composition of a solution be adjusted to optimize its thermal conductivity at room temperature (25°C) to design an efficient thermal energy conversion system with improved thermal conductivity?

By testing a 0.5 M Fe(ClO₄)₂/Fe(ClO₄)₃ redox couple solution with the addition of 0.1 M HCl, investigate its thermal conductivity at 25°C. Fe(ClO₄)₂/Fe(ClO₄)₃, as a redox couple, provides stable charge transfer, while the low concentration of 0.1 M HCl is expected to moderately increase the ionic strength of the solution, thereby slightly enhancing thermal conductivity, while avoiding excessive acidity that could affect solution stability.
